intro: Disemma baueri, commonly known as the Bauer's disemma, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its delicate, pentapetalous flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and white. Its leaves are palmately lobed, and it prefers moist, well-drained soils in shaded environments. Due to habitat loss, Disemma baueri is considered endangered and is the subject of conservation efforts.
